elements.title: Corp Naomh (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 15th-century figures on the Irish reliquary known as the Corp Naomh (pictured) are based in part on a design in the 9th-century Book of Kells?

elements.title: Patricia MacLachlan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that children's writer Patricia MacLachlan kept a small bag of dirt from the prairies as a reminder of her Wyoming roots?

elements.title: Comoro River (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Comoro River, which cuts through the East Timorese capital of Dili, has seen large floods despite often running almost dry?

elements.title: 3D Microcomputers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 3D Microcomputers produced and marketed Commodore-branded computers from 1991 until over a year after Commodore's bankruptcy?

elements.title: The Seasons' Canon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the choreography of Crystal Pite's ballet The Seasons' Canon is inspired by the movement of tectonic plates?

elements.title: Nobody's Victim (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that lawyer Carrie Goldberg was inspired to share her experience of sexual violence in Nobody's Victim by her clients, who had entrusted her with their own stories?

elements.title: justice of the German Federal Constitutional Court (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Claus Leusser, a justice of the German Federal Constitutional Court, served for only four months?

elements.title: a walrus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a walrus was given his own pontoon to stop him damaging other boats in St Mary's Harbour?
